Key Arguments: The bill will damage free speech and lead to totalitarianism.
ACMA has too much power to change standards without parliamentary approval.
The definition of 'serious harm' is vague and subjective.
The bill creates a double standard by exempting certain organizations from accountability.
Digital platforms will self-censor due to fear of penalties, reducing information diversity.
The bill contradicts recent legal decisions in the USA regarding free speech.
Notable Quotes: It is the path to totalitarianism.
In defence of truth, more and better information is better than less.
This is a double standard and is unjust.
This will seriously reduce the amount and diversity of information available to the public.
